intro: Nidorella ulmifolia, commonly known as the elm-leaved nidorella, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are elongated and resemble those of the elm tree, giving it its common name. Nidorella ulmifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine in some regions.
